alternative_parents.description: Alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aralkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Phenols that are unsubstituted at the 4-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxy-4-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Phenols that a unsubstituted at the 2-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxy-2-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing one monocyclic ring system consisting of benzene.
alternative_parents.name: Benzene and substituted derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an alkyl chain with an amine group bound to the C1 atom and an alcohol group bound to the C2 atom.
alternative_parents.name: 1,2-aminoalcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a dialkylamine group, characterized by two alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an alcohol group attached to an aromatic carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Aromatic alcohols

class.description: Compounds containing a phenol moiety, which is a benzene bearing a hydroxyl group.
class.name: Phenols

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as resorcinols. These are compounds containing a resorcinol moiety, which is a benzene ring bearing two hydroxyl groups at positions 1 and 3.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing a resorcinol moiety, which is a benzene ring bearing two hydroxyl groups at positions 1 and 3.
direct_parent.name: Resorcinols

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing two hydroxyl groups attached to a benzene ring.
subclass.name: Benzenediols

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
